351.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp has written the foreword to children's book 'Thumper's London Adventure' written by his fan cancer survivor Katie Vanrdrilla. Johnny first met Katie in 2011 when she was diagnosed with leukemia and wished to meet the actor through the Make-A-Wish Foundation. Johnny wrote, "For my dearest Katie, for her dear family and friends...Please know that you are loved."

352.title: Secure enough to know we can co-exist: Janhvi on equation with Sara, Ananya
352.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor opened up on her equation with Sara Ali Khan and Ananya Panday and said she's "really fond of these girls". She added that she has a lot of respect for what they do and wants them to do really well. "I think they'd want the same for me...We're secure enough to know that we can...co-exist," said Janhvi.

353.title: 1,000+ dark spots in Delhi to be lit for women's safety, ₹11 cr allocated
353.article_body: More than 1,000 dark spots in Delhi will be lit up by the civic agencies to strengthen women's safety in the city. Reports said that the Centre has allocated ₹11 crore for the project. "Such spots in the South, West and North Delhi will soon be illuminated with new LED lights," officials said.

354.title: Sula Vineyards to go public, files IPO papers with SEBI
354.article_body: Nashik-based Sula Vineyards has filed draft papers with the Securities and Exchange Board of India to raise capital through an IPO. The IPO will be entirely an offer for sale (OFS) with up to 25,546,186 equity shares put up for sale. The company has not finalised the date or price of the IPO as yet.

355.title: Request Yashwant to withdraw from Presidential race: Ex-MP Prakash Ambedkar
355.article_body: Vanchit Bahujan Aaghadi National President and former MP Prakash Ambedkar has requested Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha to withdraw from the race. He said that Sinha should do so as many Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe members from across parties are joining to vote for NDA's candidate Droupadi Murmu. Murmu will become the first tribal President of India if elected.

356.title: 59-yr-old man arrested in Mumbai for not returning Brazilian student's bag
356.article_body: An autorickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly not returning a Brazilian student's bag after the latter forgot it inside the vehicle in Mumbai's Goregaon East area. Later, the student, Marina Leao (23), registered an FIR at the Dindoshi Police Station against the accused, Kanhaiyalal Pal (59). The bag, which had Leao's passport and iPad, was returned to her, police said.

357.title: Unfit Biden won't finish his term: Former White House Physician
357.article_body: Claiming that US President Joe Biden is struggling with cognitive issues, former White House Physician Ronny Jackson said that Biden won't be able to finish his four-year term in office. "Everyone knows he's unfit for the job. His mind is too far gone," Jackson added. Biden, who is 79, is the oldest person to serve as the US President.

358.title: People want refreshing ideas, not stale formula films: Kangana on Emergency
358.article_body: Discussing her film 'Emergency' where she'll portray late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, actress Kangana Ranaut said, "The audience is looking for something which will stimulate their intellectual side and not just their sensual side." "This is what people are starved for...People...want to see...refreshing ideas and not...stale typical formula films," she added. Kangana will also direct the film.

359.title: My belongings were stolen when I was a student: Mahindra on Mumbai Police's post
359.article_body: Mumbai Police shared a post stating that officers helped a Brazilian student by catching an auto-rickshaw driver who stole her iPad, visa, passport and ₹15,000 cash. Replying to the tweet, Anand Mahindra said, "I can just imagine the relief for this young woman. I've had my belongings stolen while traveling overseas as a student and it's a harrowing experience."

360.title: 'Jumlajeevi' unparliamentary as 'Mahamanush' upset: Congress leader
360.article_body: Rajasthan Congress chief Govind Singh Dotasra tweeted, "Jumlas were given in the name of jobs. It was nothing wrong then and now you are feeling 'jumlajeevi' is unparliamentary." "Say straightforward..the mood of 'Mahamanush' is upset with the opposition raising public issues in Parliament," he added. This comes after list of words not allowed in the Parliament was released.

361.title: 14 sheep die, several critical after eating poisonous plants in Pune
361.article_body: As many as 14 sheep died and several others are in a critical condition after allegedly grazing on poisonous plants in Indapur tehsil of Pune district, officials said. Preliminary investigation showed that the sheep might have consumed the Lantana camara plant, which is a type of weed, the District Deputy Commissioner of the Animal Husbandry Department said.

362.title: K'taka HC summons BBMP engineers over lake encroachments in Bengaluru
362.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has asked executive engineers of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to appear before it on July 20 over encroachment of lakes in Bengaluru. The court ordered summons while hearing a petition regarding encroachment in Subramanyapura, Begur and Puttenahalli lakes. The court observed that writing letters to departments wasn't enough to remove encroachments.

363.title: Pics show Antarctica's sky turning purple after volcanic eruption
363.article_body: Months after the Tongan volcanic eruption, the Antarctic sky has turned shades of purple due to the afterglow from the eruption. The Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano erupted in January, triggering a tsunami. Following the eruption, aerosols made of sulphate particles, sea salt and water vapour circulated in the air, bending and scattering sunlight and creating a glow in the sky.

364.title: Rare animal spotted in the Pacific Ocean for the first time ever, pic surfaces
364.article_body: A rare animal was spotted in the Pacific Ocean for the first time ever. The Solumbellula sea pen, a colonial cnidarian, was spotted by scientists at 2,994 metres on a never-before-surveyed seamount north of Johnston Atoll. The Solumbellula sea pen had a single large feeding polyp with pinnate tentacles stretching over 40 cm from its 2-metre-long stalk.

365.title: Drunk assailants attack people on Pune roads, bite policeman
365.article_body: A group of suspected drunk persons, including a 17-year-old boy, attacked people for no reason on Pune's Kelkar Road and Tilak Road on Friday. One of them also bit a policeman when he tried to stop them. "They were carrying a sharp weapon while moving in the autorickshaw," police said. A video of the incident went viral on social media.

366.title: Making a comeback at 35-plus was never going to be easy: 37-yr-old Karthik
366.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, who recently returned to India squad after almost three years in T20I series against South Africa, said making a comeback at 35-plus was never going to be easy. "I quietly believed in myself and did the hard yards before the IPL," he added. The 37-year-old scored his maiden T20I fifty in Rajkot last month.

367.title: 31-yr-old Kerala man stabbed to death on Bengaluru outskirts, probe on
367.article_body: A 31-year-old man from Kerala was stabbed to death on the outskirts of Bengaluru on Thursday night. The deceased, identified as Sanu Thomson, worked at a factory in Jigani. According to police, Thomson was returning to his paying guest accommodation on Thursday when three men on a bike stabbed him with a knife and fled from the spot.

368.title: 'Revari' culture dangerous for country's development: PM Modi in UP
368.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, after inaugurating the Bundelkhand Expressway in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday, cautioned people against "revari (sweet) culture" and said, "It could be very dangerous for the development of the country." "Those with revari culture will never build new expressways, new airports or defence corridors for you. Together we have to defeat this thinking," the PM added.

369.title: Blood of Saudi Crown Prince's next victim is on your hands: Khashoggi's fiancee to Biden
369.article_body: After US President Joe Biden met Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and fist-bumped with the leader, Jamal Khashoggi's fiancee Hatice Cengiz said, "The blood of MBS' next victim is on your hands." Biden said he holds MBS responsible for Khashoggi's death, adding, "I'm sorry she (Cengiz) feels that way. I was straightforward back then. I was straightforward today."

370.title: Performed in farewell party wearing jacket from Chor Bazaar: Rajkummar
370.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said he performed at his school's farewell party wearing a jacket worth ₹100 and a chain costing ₹15 which he purchased from Delhi's Chor Bazaar, as he was battling financial struggle. Discussing the period when he moved to Mumbai, Rajkummar had said, "There were times when I lived on one Parle-G packet a day with...₹18 in my...account."

371.title: Lawyer fined ₹50,000 for accusing Jain of owning benami property: AAP
371.article_body: AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj on Friday said that Delhi Lokayukta has imposed a fine of ₹50,000 on advocate Neeraj for falsely accusing minister Satyendar Jain of owning benami property. Neeraj has not produced any evidence against the AAP leader in court, Bharadwaj added. He further accused BJP of misusing powers of agencies like ED and CBI to malign AAP leaders.

372.title: West too focused on Ukraine to devote much time to SL: Ex-Indian envoy
372.article_body: India's ex-Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Ashok Kantha, said that the "western world is too caught up with Ukraine to devote much time and resources" to the ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka. "Other than India, which has pledged close to $4 billion as economic assistance to Sri Lanka, western agencies like...World Bank and...IMF have done very little," Kantha told Moneycontrol.

373.title: India is the only country that's given us credit line: SL Minister amid crisis
373.article_body: Sri Lankan Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera on Saturday said that India is the "only country" that has provided Sri Lanka with a credit line amid a severe economic crisis there. India has committed $3.8 billion to support Sri Lanka. Wijesekera said Sri Lanka is also in discussions with the Russian government for support.

374.title: It doesn't bother me if somebody bitches about me: Ranbir on being called a casanova
374.article_body: In a recent conversation with Bollywood Bubble, Ranbir Kapoor opened up about the "casanova" and "cheater" image he has. "People have heard somebody's perspective...and they haven't heard mine," he said. "My focus, my hard work, my energies are only towards making a good film and it really doesn't bother me if somebody bitches about me," Ranbir added.

375.title: 80 B.Ed students expelled for carrying phones in exam centre in Bihar
375.article_body: As many as 80 B.Ed students have been expelled for carrying mobile phones and guess papers in the exam centre in Bihar's Bhojpur district, an official said. "We received an input about cheating on a large scale taking place at HD Jain College...we constituted a team of male and female duty magistrates to conduct raids," Bhojpur DC said.

376.title: IT Ministry says content removal on Twitter proportional to Indian user base: Report
376.article_body: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology in an official review reportedly stated that the Centre's content removal orders to Twitter are "proportional" to the expanding Indian user base. The ministry said, "India is 7% of Twitter's global user base and so is the volume of removal requests." Earlier, Twitter challenged the Centre's 39 blocking orders, saying that they're arbitrary.

377.title: Garfield in talks to star as billionaire Richard Branson in a limited series
377.article_body: 'The Amazing Spider-Man' actor Andrew Garfield is in talks to portray billionaire Richard Branson in a limited series called 'Hot Air', as per Variety. It'll be directed by David Leitch, who has helmed movies like 'Deadpool 2' and 'Fast & Furious: Hobbs & Shaw'. The six-part series is based on book 'Dirty Tricks: British Airways' Secret War Against Virgin Atlantic'.

378.title: Israel strikes Gaza after rocket attack amid Biden's visit to region
378.article_body: Israeli jets struck Gaza Strip following rocket launches from the Palestinian territory on Saturday. The incident comes hours after US President Joe Biden flew from Israel to Saudi Arabia during a trip to the Middle East. The Israeli military said it had hit two facilities belonging to Hamas, the group that governs Gaza Strip.

379.title: I would hide when people watched 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani': Maker Ayan
379.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, who directed Ranbir Kapoor and Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani', said, "I used to hide when people...[watched the film]...'Oh my God what would they say', 'I hope they like the film' etc." "As a filmmaker you...feel very vulnerable and naked when you put out your film," added Ayan. "I am very nervous [about 'Brahmastra']," he stated.

380.title: Chiranjeevi hugs teary-eyed Aamir, says 'Laal Singh Chaddha' is a 'gem'
380.article_body: Veteran actor Chiranjeevi Konidela has shared a video from the special screening of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', which was organised by Aamir Khan at the former's residence in Hyderabad. In the video, Chiranjeevi could be seen hugging Aamir who was in tears after the screening. "What a gem of a film you have made!! Such a wonderful emotional journey," Chiranjeevi wrote.

381.title: Maharashtra cabinet clears proposal to name Navi Mumbai airport after DB Patil
381.article_body: The Maharashtra cabinet has cleared a proposal to name the upcoming Navi Mumbai International Airport after the late farm leader DB Patil. The decision comes weeks after protestors marched in Belapur demanding to name the under-construction airport after Patil. Notably, an earlier proposal to name the airport after Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray had sparked protests across a few districts.

382.title: Chahal is up there with the best, adapted game in couple of years: Hogg
382.article_body: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg has said that India's Yuzvendra Chahal is right "up there with the best". "Chahal has adapted his game in the past couple of years. He had a period there where he got found out, but then he found a method to rebuild himself," Hogg said. "Chahal has grown as an individual as well," he added.

383.title: Served motherland to the best of my ability: Sri Lanka ex-Prez in resignation e-mail
383.article_body: Sri Lanka's former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa who resigned amid a raging economic crisis e-mailed his resignation letter to the Parliament Speaker after fleeing to Singapore. The letter, read in the Parliament on Saturday, said, "I served my motherland to the best of my ability and I'll continue to do so in future." He blamed COVID-19 for Sri Lanka's economic troubles.

384.title: Virat Kohli shares his pic with 'What if I fall...' quote amid criticism over form
384.article_body: Virat Kohli took to social media to share a picture of himself with an artwork of a quote that read 'What if I fall...Oh but my darling, what if you fly'. "Perspective," Kohli wrote in the caption. This comes amid Kohli facing criticism over his poor form. "People can only dream about what you’ve done in cricket," Kevin Pietersen commented.

385.title: Cyberabad police shares video, says 'Dangerous to travel on top of vehicle'
385.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Saturday shared a video of an accident and said that it's "dangerous" to travel while sitting on top of vehicles. The video is of an accident in which a 13-year-old boy, who was travelling while sitting on top of a vehicle, died after getting hit by the front part of a crane, the traffic police added.

386.title: B'luru-Mangaluru traffic disrupted after vehicle ban in Shiradi Ghat
386.article_body: Officials in Karnataka's Hassan have issued orders prohibiting the movement of vehicles on the Shiradi Ghat stretch of NH-75 connecting Bengaluru and Mangaluru. Officials, who had earlier only restricted traffic at night in the ghat section following landslides, prohibited all vehicles from moving in the ghat and suggested alternate routes through Charmadi Ghat and Madikeri to reach Mangaluru.

387.title: Gujarat businessman threatened for uploading Nupur Sharma's pic, 3 held
387.article_body: Three people were arrested after they allegedly threatened a businessman in Gujarat for uploading suspended Bharatiya Janata Party leader Nupur Sharma's picture on Instagram. An official said that the complainant got threats from seven people after uploading the picture. Search is also on for four other accused. The arrested accused have been booked under IPC sections.

388.title: I could retire from football at the age of 55: Italy legend Buffon
388.article_body: Italian legend Gianluigi Buffon, who has previously played for Juventus and PSG, said he could retire from football at the age of 55. "I've been thinking about retirement for 10 years, but...always continued," added Buffon. Revealing the top five foreign players he has played with during his career, Buffon named Lilian Thuram, Neymar, Kylian Mbappe, Cristiano Ronaldo and Zlatan Ibrahimović.

389.title: Australia reinstates COVID-19 quarantine payments amid rising cases
389.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese said the country will reinstate support payments for casual workers who have to quarantine due to COVID-19. The leave payments, which ended on June 30 and entitled workers to get up to A$750 ($510) for each seven-day quarantine period, will remain in place until September-end, he added. This comes amid rising COVID-19 cases in the country.

390.title: Tempo driver attacked after bike, tempo collide in Pune; 2 booked
390.article_body: A case has been filed against two brothers for allegedly assaulting a tempo driver after the bike the duo was riding hit the latter's vehicle in Pune's Ghotawade Phata. The tempo driver had offered to treat the bike's rider, however, the duo called their relatives and attacked the former, according to the complaint. The incident occurred on July 12.

391.title: Punjab woman held for killing 4-yr-old son says 'Killed daughter 10 yrs ago'
391.article_body: A woman who was arrested for killing her four-year-old son in Punjab's Ludhiana has also confessed to killing her daughter 10 years ago. "Babita confessed to killing her six-year-old daughter, 10 years ago. She also admitted to terminated two pregnancies by hitting her abdomen with a hard substance to induce a miscarriage," police said.

392.title: Breach in drain floods fields, damages crop on 150 acres in Punjab
392.article_body: A breach in a seasonal drain on Friday flooded fields and damaged paddy crops spread over 150 acres in the Patti sub-division of Punjab's Tarn Taran amid heavy rainfall. About 12 farmers were affected by the incident. One of the farmers claimed, "The fields won't dry up for many days and I'll not be able to sow the paddy again."

393.title: I told Saudi Crown Prince I hold him responsible for Khashoggi's murder: Biden
393.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday said that he told Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman that he held him responsible for the murder of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi. "He basically said that he was not personally responsible for it," Biden said of the Crown Prince's response during their meeting.

394.title: 23-yr-old girl defeats Union Minister's sister in MP panchayat polls
394.article_body: A 23-year-old girl has defeated Union Minister of State Faggan Singh Kulaste's sister in the recently held three-tier panchayat elections in Madhya Pradesh's Mandla district. According to reports, Lalita Dhurve, who contested with the support of Gondwana Gantantra Party, defeated Kulaste's sister, Priya Dhurve, by 3900 votes. Lalita is the youngest district panchayat member in the district.

395.title: AAP to support Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha
395.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh on Saturday said that the party will support the Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha. "We respect Droupadi Murmu but we will vote for Yashwant Sinha," he added. Notably, AAP has 92 MLAs and seven Rajya Sabha MPs. Earlier, Shiv Sena announced its support for Droupadi Murmu for Presidential elections.

396.title: Heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning in several states; IMD releases list
396.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted isolated heavy rainfall over Madhya Pradesh, Coastal Karnataka, Goa, Kerala, Chhattisgarh, Coastal Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and Telangana between July 16 and 20. Isolated very heavy rainfall is expected over Odisha, Himachal Pradesh, while Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh will likely receive extremely heavy rainfall.

397.title: Mumbai Police seize e-cigarettes, flavoured tobacco; 11 arrested
397.article_body: The Mumbai Police seized electronic cigarettes and flavoured tobacco, worth over ₹14.60 lakh, after conducting raids at 12 different locations in the city. Also, during the operation, which was carried out by the Crime Branch control of the Economic Offences Wing, 11 people were arrested in connection with the case, an official said.

398.title: 11 more die in Gujarat due to heavy rains, toll reaches 54
398.article_body: The death toll due to heavy rains in Gujarat reached up to 54 as 11 more people died in a day. Disaster Management Minister Rajendra Trivedi said the deaths were caused by drowning, wall collapse and electrocution. "Three of them fell off a bridge and died," Trivedi said. Purna and Ambika rivers overflowed at three places, he added.

399.title: India needed a knock like Stokes' in 2019 WC final: Giles on 2nd ODI
399.article_body: Reacting to India's 100-run defeat in the second ODI against England, ex-England spinner Ashley Giles said India needed a batter to play a knock just like Ben Stokes played in the 2019 World Cup final. "Someone needs to take the game by the scruff of the neck," added Giles. Stokes scored 84* as England beat New Zealand in the final.

400.title: Twitter's sudden speed for trial after 2 months of foot-dragging is a tactic: Musk
400.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has opposed Twitter's request for a fast-track trial over the $44 billion deal termination. In a filing, Musk said, "Twitter's sudden request for warp speed after two months of foot-dragging...is its latest tactic to shroud the truth about spam accounts long enough to railroad defendants into closing." Twitter has requested that the trial begin in September.

401.title: Irrfan Khan wanted to be an 'urban farmer', says wife Sutapa Sikdar
401.article_body: Late actor Irrfan Khan wanted to be an 'urban farmer', his wife Sutapa Sikdar said. Sutapa, on Friday, shared a picture of their son Ayan holding a bunch of bananas and wrote, "When...your boy is trying to look like...farmer in...village market." After a user commented, "Our in-house farmer," Sutapa responded, "Yes, urban farmer what his father truly wanted to become."
